head.title: The Many Ways to Teach a Child

hedline.hl1: The Many Ways to Teach a Child

abstract.p: Ian J Drake letter responds to Robert B Reich's July 11 Op-ed article that criticized education system and standardized testing; asserts Reich misconstrues goal of education as job preparation (M)

block.p: Robert B. Reich (Op-Ed, July 11) appears to assume that most forms and levels of education have one goal: job preparation. He suggests that the economy is so diverse that standardized tests will force students to be measured on matters unrelated to their interests and career prospects.

Robert B. Reich (Op-Ed, July 11) appears to assume that most forms and levels of education have one goal: job preparation. He suggests that the economy is so diverse that standardized tests will force students to be measured on matters unrelated to their interests and career prospects.

The education system should prepare students with knowledge and skills with which to begin their understanding of the world. If students have basics under their belt, then they will be prepared to specialize or change careers when they find they are ill suited for or unsatisfied in them. Standardized testing is merely an objective method by which cognitive output can be measured.
IAN J. DRAKE Burlington, N.C., July 11, 2000
